Emergency Fund: Why You Need One
Life has a knack for throwing surprises our way, and emergencies are
almost always unexpected and sudden. While we can’t foresee when these
situations will arise, we certainly have the power to prepare for them by
establishing an emergency fund.
Picture this: you crack a tooth while savouring a lollipop, injure yourself
during sports activity, experience a vehicle breakdown, or face a sudden
job loss – but with an emergency fund readily available, you won’t have to
stress about how to cover the unexpected bills. You can rest easy at night,
knowing you’ll be okay in those challenging moments.
Looking back three years ago, the mark left by the COVID-19 pandemic on
our lives remains vivid as ever, making it clear that having savings is not
just a financial luxury but a fundamental necessity. This unprecedented
global crisis has opened our eyes to the stark reality that savings serve as a
vital lifeline during times of unexpected challenges.
Whether you’re facing sudden job losses, unexpected medical bills, or
unforeseen emergencies, having a well-established emergency fund
provides financial stability to weather the storm.
What is an emergency fund?
An emergency fund, often called 'rainy day savings', is a dedicated pool of
money you set aside specifically to navigate life's unforeseen financial
challenges. These savings are meant for real, urgent needs, like covering
rent during times of low income or handling un

money you set aside specifically to navigate life's unforeseen financial
challenges. These savings are meant for real, urgent needs, like covering
rent during times of low income or handling unexpected medical bills.
It’s not a personal slush fund for your spontaneous getaways or fashion
emergencies, no matter how tempting it may be to dip into those extra
savings. Understanding when to use your emergency fund is just as
important as knowing why you need one in the first place.
Why is it important to have an emergency fund?
Emergencies can take a toll on our physical, mental, and emotional health,
so it's important to have a financial safety net in place. There are
numerous reasons why you need an emergency fund:
1. You’ll be prepared
An emergency fund complements your budget by providing a financial
cushion for unexpected expenses, helping you maintain your long-term
financial goals.
2. You’ll save money
An emergency fund ensures that you can address unexpected expenses
without derailing your financial progress. It allows you to protect your longterm financial goals by avoiding the need to rely on credit cards or loans,
ultimately saving you money and helping you maintain a solid financial
foundation without accumulating debt.
3. You’ll be at ease
Knowing you have a financial cushion can provide a profound sense of
ease. It grants you the confidence to navigate unforeseen challenges
without the added burden of worrying about how to fund them.

While we can’t predict the next emergency, we can prepare for it. Building

How to build your emergency fund?

Ready to build your emergency savings (or realising you need to save
more)? If you’re eager to begin but unsure where to start – here are five
EN
suggestions that might make it easier:
1. Set a specific goal
You can begin by defining a clear target for your emergency fund.
Determine the amount you want to save, which often aligns with at least
three to six months’ worth of living expenses, but the ideal amount can
vary depending on your individual circumstances and comfort level.
2. Create a budget
The next crucial step is to record and track your monthly income and
expenses. This process will not only provide a comprehensive view of your
financial situation but also help you pinpoint areas where you can reduce
spending on non-essential items. By doing so, you can free up additional
funds to bolster your emergency fund.
If you're looking for a digital tool to manage your expenses and build your
emergency fund, the Belanjawanku app by EPF stands out as a valuable
tool. This app simplifies the process of categorising and tracking your
monthly and annual expenses, laying a solid foundation for effect

ncy fund, the Belanjawanku app by EPF stands out as a valuable
tool. This app simplifies the process of categorising and tracking your
monthly and annual expenses, laying a solid foundation for effective
budgeting, including creating and growing your emergency fund.
With the Belanjawanku app, you have the flexibility to choose your
preferred tracking method, whether it’s using the estimates from the
Belanjawanku guide or the Rule of Thumb method (45/35/20 Rule). This
helps you compare your spendings to the recommended budget, gaining a
clearer understanding of your financial situation.
Through the Belanjawanku app, you can make informed decisions about
how much to set aside for your emergency fund. The app is available for
download on the Apple App Store, Google Play Store and Huawei App
Gallery.
3. Open a dedicated savings account
Consider opening a dedicated savings account solely for your emergency
fund. This separation makes it easier to identify which funds are reserved
for emergencies and avoid unintentional spending on non-emergency
items.
4. Set up automatic transfers
Simplify your savings by setting up automatic transfers from your primary
account to your dedicated emergency fund savings account. This will help
you build your fund consistently and effortlessly.
5. Start small, increase gradually
If saving a significant amount seems challenging at first, begin with a more
manageable goal and progressively raise your contributions as your
financial situation improves.

Start small and set aside a regular amount of money each month. Over
time, your savings will grow, and you'll have a financial cushion to fall back
on if something unexpected happens.
What if I need a backup?
While you diligently build your emergency fund, there may be instances
when it falls short of covering unforeseen expenses. But don’t worry! You
have other options to protect yourself.
You can tap into your Akaun Sejahtera savings for Health Withdrawal,
which covers a wide range of critical illness treatments or essential
healthcare equipment. It’s there to extend a helping hand to you, your
spouse, your parents and your children during challenging medical
situations – providing much-needed financial support.
EPF also offers the Member Protection Plan through the i-Lindung
platform, designed to provide financial security and peace of mind for your
medical needs. You can choose affordable life and/ or critical illness
insurance coverage, with payments drawn yearly from your Akaun
Sejahtera. Besides, you can choose from various insurance providers to suit
your specific medical needs
